title: Disadvantages of Survey
question_text: Which of the following represents a disadvantage of gathering data by using a survey?

choices.text: A survey cannot be used to help estimate a population parameter such as a population mean or population proportion.
Since a survey must be conducted in person, it is a very time-consuming way to gather data.
A survey is a very expensive method of collecting data. It can be even more expensive to properly analyze the results of the survey.
There is likely to be a lot of undercoverage when conducting a survey since some individuals may choose not to respond to the survey.
Surveys must be designed carefully or the results may be unreliable due to response bias.
